alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 20 at 8:46AM AKST until November 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. Very strong winds could cause damage, power outages, and difficulty for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...No additional snow is expected during this event. Reduced visibilities will be caused by winds lifting and blowing transportable snow already on the ground. Periods of blowing snow are also possible for Keystone Canyon and Valdez.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
